document.masterDocTitle: The crab spiders of the genus Lysiteles from Yunnan Province, China (Araneae: Thomisidae)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 11 a–i.
Lysiteles kunmingensis
Song & Zhao, 1994
. a – b Habitus (a male, b female); c – e, g Left palp (c prolateral, c, g ventral, e retrolateral view); f, h Epigyne; i Vulva. Scale bars: a – b = 1; c – i = 0.1.

Distribution. Bhutan , China (recorded from Counties of Gongshan, Tengchong, Fugong, Longling and Yongping, also from Kunming City, Yunnan Province).

Remarks. This species is similar to
L. excultus
(O. P.-Cambridge, 1885 ) in general appearance and the structures of genital organs. It is very difficulty to find differences between figs 3 a–c given in
Song & Zhao ( 1994 )
for
L. kunmingensis
and figs. 19–24 given in
Marusik ( 1993 )
for
L. excultus .
Possibly, this species is a junior synonym of
L. excultus
.
